flawed_nl_solution:
He gets his pool cleaned 30/3=<<30/3=10>>10 times a month
Each time he gets it cleaned he tips 150*0.1=$<<150*0.1=15>>15
So he pays 150+15=$<<150+15=156>>156
So he pays 156*10=$<<156*10=1560>>1560 a month on cleaning
The chemicals cost 200*2=$<<200*2=400>>400
So in total, he pays 1560+400=$<<1560+400=1960>>1960

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 165.0, not 156.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
